roleset.name: make calm
roleset.note: CALM-V NOTES: Reserve the instrument case for sentences with both an agent and aninstrument. (from calm.01-v)

example.name: just transitive
example.text: He said he's upset that [Mr. Phelan]-2, *trace* trying *trace*-2 to calm investors after the plunge, said that investors would simply have to get used to the market's big price swings.

example.name: ergative!
example.text: Dealers said [London]-1 showed signs of *trace*-1 calming in midafternoon...

example.name: all args
example.text: In an unusual move, [several funds]-2 moved *trace*-2 to calm investors with recordings on their toll-free phone lines.

roleset.name: still, relaxed
roleset.note: CALM-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, BOLT-4,5, relation to calm-v.01 (rolesets not combined because of incompatability between causative roles and topic roles.) (from calm.01-j)

example.name: inanimate arg1
example.text: The ocean was calm and the clouds were high on this quiet beach near Hanalei.
example.arg: on this quiet beach near Hanalei

example.name: arg1, ADV-attributive
example.text: i was calm about all of this until a few hours ago

example.name: concatenation of infinitival complement
example.text: Some horses just don't cope with this - my girl was calm to ride in winter and turned into a spooky bundle of nerves in spring

example.name: ergative with particle
example.text: Mideast politics have calmed down and the squabbling within the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries seems under control for now.
